verses.verse: And the famine <S%H7458><s%> was sore <S%H3515><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H3615><s%>, when they had eaten up the grain <S%H7668><s%> which they had brought out <S%H935><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, their father <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H7725><s%>, Go again, buy <S%H7666><s%> us a little <S%H4592><s%> food <S%H400><s%>.

And Judah <S%H3063><s%> spake <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H559><s%>, saying, The man <S%H376><s%> did solemnly <S%H5749><s%> protest <S%H5749><s%> unto us <S%H559><s%>, saying, Ye shall not see <S%H7200><s%> my face <S%H6440><s%>, except <S%H1115><s%> your brother be with you <S%H251><s%>.
If thou wilt <S%H3426><s%> send <S%H7971><s%> our brother <S%H251><s%> with us <S%H3381><s%>, we will go down and buy <S%H7666><s%> thee food <S%H400><s%>:

but if thou wilt not send <S%H7971><s%> him <S%H3381><s%>, we will not go down; for the man <S%H376><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto us <S%H7200><s%>, Ye shall not see my face <S%H6440><s%>, except your brother be with you <S%H251><s%>.
And Israel <S%H3478><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Wherefore dealt ye so ill <S%H7489><s%> with me <S%H5046><s%>, as to tell the man <S%H376><s%> whether ye had yet a brother <S%H251><s%>?

And they said <S%H559><s%>, The man <S%H376><s%> asked <S%H7592><s%> straitly <S%H7592><s%> concerning ourselves <S%H4138><s%>, and concerning our kindred, saying <S%H559><s%>, Is your father <S%H1><s%> yet <S%H3426><s%> alive <S%H2416><s%>? have ye <S%H3426><s%> another brother <S%H251><s%>? and we told <S%H5046><s%> him according <S%H5921><s%> to the tenor <S%H6310><s%> of these words <S%H1697><s%>: could we in any wise know <S%H3045><s%> that he would say <S%H559><s%>, Bring <S%H3381><s%> your brother <S%H251><s%> down <S%H3381><s%>?

And Judah <S%H3063><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Israel <S%H3478><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>, Send <S%H7971><s%> the lad <S%H5288><s%> with me <S%H6965><s%>, and we will arise and go <S%H3212><s%>; that we may live <S%H2421><s%>, and not die <S%H4191><s%>, both we <S%H2945><s%>, and thou, and also our little ones.

I will be surety <S%H6148><s%> for him <S%H3027><s%>; of my hand shalt thou require <S%H1245><s%> him <S%H518><s%>: if I bring <S%H935><s%> him not <S%H518><s%> unto thee <S%H3322><s%>, and set him before thee <S%H6440><s%>, then let me bear the blame <S%H2398><s%> for ever <S%H3117><s%>:
for except <S%H3884><s%> we had lingered <S%H4102><s%>, surely we had now returned <S%H7725><s%> a second time <S%H6471><s%>.

And their father <S%H1><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H645><s%>, If it be so now, do <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H3947><s%>: take of the choice fruits <S%H2173><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> in your vessels <S%H3627><s%>, and carry down <S%H3381><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> a present <S%H4503><s%>, a little <S%H4592><s%> balm <S%H6875><s%>, and a little <S%H4592><s%> honey <S%H1706><s%>, spicery <S%H5219><s%> and myrrh <S%H3910><s%>, nuts <S%H992><s%>, and almonds <S%H8247><s%>;

and take <S%H3947><s%> double <S%H4932><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> in your hand <S%H3027><s%>; and the money <S%H3701><s%> that was returned <S%H7725><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of your sacks <S%H572><s%> carry again <S%H7725><s%> in your hand <S%H3027><s%>; peradventure it was an oversight <S%H4870><s%>:
take <S%H3947><s%> also your brother <S%H251><s%>, and arise <S%H6965><s%>, go again <S%H7725><s%> unto the man <S%H376><s%>:

and God <S%H410><s%> Almighty <S%H7706><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> you mercy <S%H7356><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the man <S%H376><s%>, that he may release <S%H7971><s%> unto you your other <S%H312><s%> brother <S%H251><s%> and Benjamin <S%H1144><s%>. And if <S%H834><s%> I be bereaved <S%H7921><s%> of my children <S%H7921><s%>, I am bereaved.

And the men <S%H582><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> that <S%H2063><s%> present <S%H4503><s%>, and they took <S%H3947><s%> double <S%H4932><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> in their hand <S%H3027><s%>, and Benjamin <S%H1144><s%>; and rose up <S%H6965><s%>, and went down <S%H3381><s%> to Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and stood <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>.

And when Joseph <S%H3130><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Benjamin <S%H1144><s%> with <S%H854><s%> them <S%H559><s%>, he said to the steward of his house <S%H1004><s%>, Bring <S%H935><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> into the house <S%H1004><s%>, and slay <S%H2873><s%>, and make ready <S%H3559><s%>; for the men <S%H582><s%> shall dine <S%H398><s%> with me at noon <S%H6672><s%>.
And the man <S%H376><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> as Joseph <S%H3130><s%> bade <S%H559><s%>; and the man <S%H376><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> to Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>.

And the men <S%H582><s%> were afraid <S%H3372><s%>, because they were brought <S%H935><s%> to Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>; and they said <S%H559><s%>, Because <S%H1697><s%> of the money <S%H3701><s%> that was returned <S%H7725><s%> in our sacks <S%H572><s%> at the first time <S%H8462><s%> are we brought in <S%H935><s%>; that he may seek occasion <S%H1556><s%> against us <S%H5307><s%>, and fall upon us <S%H3947><s%>, and take us for bondmen <S%H5650><s%>, and our asses <S%H2543><s%>.
And they came near <S%H5066><s%> to the steward <S%H376><s%> of Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, and they spake <S%H1696><s%> unto him at the door <S%H6607><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%>,
and said <S%H559><s%>, Oh <S%H994><s%>, my lord <S%H113><s%>, we came indeed <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> at the first time <S%H8462><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> food <S%H400><s%>:

and it came to pass <S%H935><s%>, when we came to the lodging-place <S%H4411><s%>, that we opened <S%H6605><s%> our sacks <S%H572><s%>, and <S%H376><s%>, behold, every man's money <S%H3701><s%> was in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of his sack <S%H572><s%>, our money <S%H3701><s%> in full weight <S%H4948><s%>: and we have brought it again <S%H7725><s%> in our hand <S%H3027><s%>.

And other <S%H312><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> have we brought down <S%H3381><s%> in our hand <S%H3027><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> food <S%H400><s%>: we know not who <S%H3045><s%> put <S%H7760><s%> our money <S%H3701><s%> in our sacks <S%H572><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Peace <S%H7965><s%> be to you <S%H3372><s%>, fear not <S%H430><s%>: your God, and the God <S%H430><s%> of your father <S%H1><s%>, hath given <S%H5414><s%> you treasure <S%H4301><s%> in your sacks <S%H572><s%>: I had <S%H935><s%> your money <S%H3701><s%>. And he brought <S%H3318><s%> Simeon out unto them <S%H8095><s%>.

And the man <S%H376><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> into Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, and gave <S%H5414><s%> them water <S%H4325><s%>, and they washed <S%H7364><s%> their feet <S%H7272><s%>; and he gave <S%H5414><s%> their asses <S%H2543><s%> provender <S%H4554><s%>.

And they made ready <S%H3559><s%> the present <S%H4503><s%> against <S%H5704><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s coming <S%H935><s%> at noon <S%H6672><s%>: for they heard <S%H8085><s%> that they should eat <S%H398><s%> bread there <S%H3899><s%>.

And when Joseph <S%H3130><s%> came <S%H935><s%> home <S%H1004><s%>, they brought <S%H935><s%> him the present <S%H4503><s%> which was in their hand <S%H3027><s%> into the house <S%H1004><s%>, and bowed <S%H7812><s%> down themselves to him to the earth <S%H776><s%>.

And he asked <S%H7592><s%> them of their welfare <S%H7965><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Is your father <S%H1><s%> well <S%H7965><s%>, the old man <S%H2205><s%> of whom ye spake <S%H559><s%>? Is he yet alive <S%H2416><s%>?

And they said <S%H559><s%>, Thy servant <S%H5650><s%> our father <S%H1><s%> is well <S%H7965><s%>, he is yet alive <S%H2416><s%>. And they bowed the head <S%H6915><s%>, and made obeisance <S%H7812><s%>.

And he lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> Benjamin <S%H1144><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%>, his mother <S%H517><s%>'s son <S%H1121><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, Is this your youngest <S%H6996><s%> brother <S%H251><s%>, of whom ye spake <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H559><s%>? And he said, God <S%H430><s%> be gracious <S%H2603><s%> unto thee <S%H1121><s%>, my son.

And Joseph <S%H3130><s%> made haste <S%H4116><s%>; for his heart <S%H7356><s%> yearned <S%H3648><s%> over his brother <S%H251><s%>: and he sought <S%H1245><s%> where to weep <S%H1058><s%>; and he entered <S%H935><s%> into his chamber <S%H2315><s%>, and wept there <S%H1058><s%>.
And he washed <S%H7364><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%>, and came out <S%H3318><s%>; and he refrained <S%H662><s%> himself <S%H559><s%>, and said, Set on <S%H7760><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>.

And they set on <S%H7760><s%> for him by himself <S%H4713><s%>, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, that did eat <S%H398><s%> with him <S%H4713><s%>, by themselves: because the Egyptians might <S%H3201><s%> not eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> with the Hebrews <S%H5680><s%>; for that is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> unto the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>.

And they sat <S%H3427><s%> before him <S%H6440><s%>, the first-born <S%H1060><s%> according to his birthright <S%H1062><s%>, and the youngest <S%H6810><s%> according to his youth <S%H6812><s%>: and the men <S%H582><s%> marvelled <S%H8539><s%> one <S%H376><s%> with another <S%H7453><s%>.

And he took <S%H5375><s%> and sent messes <S%H4864><s%> unto them from before him <S%H6440><s%>: but Benjamin <S%H1144><s%>'s mess <S%H4864><s%> was five <S%H2568><s%> times <S%H3027><s%> so much as <S%H7235><s%> any of theirs <S%H8354><s%>. And they drank, and were merry with him <S%H7937><s%>.
